name: work_email_quality
description: Evaluates professionalism, clarity, tone, and structure of a work-related email for effective communication in a global context.

items.name: clarity_and_purpose
items.description: The email clearly states its purpose early on and is easy to follow. The reader should immediately understand why the message was sent and what action (if any) is requested.

items.name: tone_and_politeness
items.description: The tone is respectful, polite, and culturally appropriate for a professional setting. It avoids slang, excessive informality, or abruptness.

items.name: structure_and_formatting
items.description: The email has a logical flow, with a greeting, body, and closing. Paragraphs are organized and the formatting supports readability (line breaks, spacing, no all-caps, etc.).

items.name: grammar_and_spelling
items.description: Spelling, punctuation, and grammar are correct enough not to distract or confuse the reader.

items.name: conciseness_and_relevance
items.description: The message is concise and focused on relevant details, avoiding unnecessary repetition or off-topic content.

items.name: professional_signoff_and_tone_consistency
items.description: The closing matches the tone of the message and includes a clear signoff with name and/or role. Tone remains consistent throughout the email.

items.name: cultural_and_contextual_fit
items.description: The message fits expected professional norms for global remote work (e.g., polite requests, awareness of time zones, indirectness when appropriate).
